channel.title: [COD4] Can someone explain this?
channel.description:
So, my friend got a mic and we thought it'd be a laugh to go on cod4 with mics. We only really did small games(tdm or hq), and I thought a ground war game would be nice. First game we went in we got slaughtered because of about 5 people on our team with a 1:10 kill:death ratio(not us :P), so we leave and end up creating our game. He's on 2mbit, I'm on 20mbit so obviously I'm hosting it. About 5 minutes in, I start lagging, the game drops to 1fps for 4-5 seconds then back up to 5, before returning to normal, and it starts again. I leave and "the host has ended the game" pops up.
If I was to host a 32, or 64 player game on my pc, I wouldn't lag, so why does COD4 lag when I'm hosting an 18 player game?

item.title: [COD4] Can someone explain this?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:8, topic:294923”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=390017.msg2913365#msg2913365 date=1250247810]

So it just happens to be my PS3? Never mind the fact that every other game I play doesn’t lag, just when I’m hosting a large game on COD4.

To answer your message sanga, only when I’m the one hosting ground war games, if I join one in progress it goes fine.

hmm anyone else using your connection intensively? that can do it, also it might not be your end if they’re end is really bad it can affect yours
[/quote]

I was the only one using the line at the time, but it doesn’t explain why I can host 32 player games on KZ2 without lag.[/quote]
because KZ2 handles connections 100x better than the call of duty games

Read full topic
